item.title: [Python] I tried to find the circle ratio of 100 million digits
item.description: # how? \zeta(2) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\frac{1}{n^2} = \frac{\pi^2}{6} (Basel Problem) You can use this formula to find an approximate value for $\pi$. Calculating $\sum_{n=1}^{a}\frac{1}{n^2}$ using $1$ as an integer from 1 to $1$ $\times6$ for the answer obtained in 2.1 Calculate the square root of the answer obtained in 3.2. This value is an approximation of $\pi$. So I implemented it in python. Code is omitted. It takes a few hours to calculate… There is no sign of ending… It takes about 18 hours to calculate the time.
